here I have made graph for Assessment Year, Estimated Revenue ($ Millions) which can readable and understandable.

```{r}

# Use the data frame you already created (tif_plot_data)
# We add a quick filter to ensure year_num is clean
final_plot_data <- tif_plot_data %>%
  filter(!is.na(year_num))

# Create the Line Chart
ggplot(final_plot_data, aes(x = year_num, y = rev_num)) +
  geom_line(color = "#2c3e50", linewidth = 1.2) + 
  geom_point(color = "#e74c3c", size = 3) +
  theme_minimal() +
  # This makes the Y-axis show "$100M" etc.
  scale_y_continuous(labels = label_dollar()) + 
  # This ensures every second year is labeled correctly
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(2000, 2021, by = 2)) + 
  labs(
    title = "Projected TIF Revenues Over Time",
    subtitle = "Iowa Urban Renewal Analysis (2000-2021)",
    x = "Assessment Year",
    y = "Estimated Revenue ($ Millions)",
    caption = "Source: TIF data Iowa"
  ) +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = 14))
```
